text: This paper examines the New Deal proposals for Young People, the Long-term Unemployed and Lone Parents. It is confined to those schemes financed by the windfall tax and does not attempt to deal with other potential elements of the Welfare-to-Work strategy such as the possible introduction of earned income tax credits.

enrichment.title: New Deal Proposals for Welfare-to-Work Strategy

text: A programme to help move people from welfare benefits into paid employment was one of the 'Five Election Pledges' contained in the Labour Party manifesto for the 1997 General Election.

enrichment.title: I Summary
enrichment.summary: A Labour Party programme aimed to transition individuals from welfare to employment as part of the 1997 election pledges.

entities.text: programme to help move people from welfare benefits into paid employment

text: The manifesto committed the party to developing schemes which would be targeted at young people, the long-term unemployed and lone parents, and which would be paid for by a windfall tax on the privatised utilities.

enrichment.title: I Summary
enrichment.summary: The manifesto proposes targeted schemes for youth, long-term unemployed, and lone parents, funded by a windfall tax on privatised utilities.

text: 1 The formal announcement came in Gordon Brown's first Budget on 2 July 1997. The windfall tax is expected to raise £5.2 billion over the period 1997-9, while the Welfare-to-Work measures described in this paper are expected to cost £3.9 billion over the five years 1997-2002.2

enrichment.title: I Summary
enrichment.summary: Gordon Brown's 1997 Budget announced a windfall tax raising £5.2 billion and Welfare-to-Work measures costing £3.9 billion over five years.

text: The plans place the emphasis on recruitment subsidies as an attempt to prevent long-term unemployment, and work experience and training for the young to increase the skills base in the labour supply and reduce the risk of young people falling into long-term unemployment.

enrichment.title: I Summary
enrichment.summary: The plans focus on recruitment subsidies and youth training to prevent long-term unemployment and enhance skills in the labor supply.

text: Advice on benefits, child-care, training and job search techniques are central to the plans for lone parents. Proposals are to be phased in over the next 2 years.

enrichment.title: I Summary
enrichment.summary: Plans for lone parents include benefits advice, child-care, training, and job search techniques, phased in over two years.

text: Pilot studies for the New Deal for Lone Parents began in July this year and the New Deal for Young People will be offered in the pathfinder areas from January 1998.

enrichment.title: I Summary
enrichment.summary: Pilot studies for the New Deal for Lone Parents started in July, and the New Deal for Young People will launch in pathfinder areas in January 1998.

text: Critics have also analysed the effectiveness of these programmes in assessing the likely effects of the Government proposals and this paper attempts to summarise

enrichment.title: I Summary
enrichment.summary: Critics evaluated program effectiveness to assess government proposals, with this paper providing a summary.

text: the large amount of material produced, particularly on wage subsidies. Lessons can also be learnt from the experience of pilot job subsidy schemes such as Workstart in this country.

enrichment.title: I Summary
enrichment.summary: Insights from wage subsidies and pilot job subsidy schemes like Workstart provide valuable lessons for employment policies.

text: The latest figures showing the numbers of people in each New Deal category are included as an appendix to this paper.

enrichment.title: I Summary
enrichment.summary: Appendix contains latest figures on the numbers of people in each New Deal category.

enrichment.title: House of Commons Library Research Paper 97/117
enrichment.summary: Research paper lists figures in new deal categories for each Parliamentary constituency.

text: The New Deal proposals consist predominantly of employment and training schemes and as such they do not require new legislation.

enrichment.title: I Summary
enrichment.summary: The New Deal proposals focus on employment and training schemes, not requiring new legislation.

text: However, the Government will be seeking to amend the *Jobseekers Allowance Regulations 1996* in order to extend benefit sanctions to those claimants on the New Deal for Young People who refuse to take up one of the available options.

enrichment.title: I Summary
enrichment.summary: The government plans to amend regulations to extend benefit sanctions for New Deal for Young People claimants refusing available options.

text:
All the schemes are expected to be available nationwide by the Autumn of 1998.

Active labour market policies have been pursued in a number of countries over the last few years and the Labour Party appears to have drawn on the experience of these schemes in developing its own policies.

enrichment.title: I Summary
enrichment.summary: Labour Party's active labour market policies are informed by international schemes and will be implemented nationwide by Autumn 1998.

header: **A. The New Deal for Young People**
text: The programme for the young unemployed was foreshadowed in Labour Party policy documents before the 1997 General Election. One of the "five election pledges" highlighted in Labour's election manifesto was to "get 250,000 under-25 year-olds off benefit and into work by using money from a windfall levy on the privatised utilities".

enrichment.title: A. The New Deal for Young People
enrichment.summary: Labour Party proposed a programme to employ 250,000 under-25s using funds from a windfall levy on privatised utilities.

header: **A. The New Deal for Young People**
text: Yet in Britain today, one in five of working-age households have no one earning a wage. In place of welfare, there should be work.

enrichment.title: A. The New Deal for Young People
enrichment.summary: Advocates replacing welfare with work to address high unemployment in working-age households in Britain.

entities.text: one in five of working-age households

header: **A. The New Deal for Young People**
text: It was set up to provide security for all, and opportunity for all, goals that are as relevant today as in 1945.

enrichment.title: A. The New Deal for Young People
enrichment.summary: The program aims to ensure security and opportunity for all, reflecting goals established in 1945.

entities.text: The New Deal for Young People

header: **A. The New Deal for Young People**
text: But for millions out of work or suffering poverty in work, the welfare state today denies rather than provides opportunity.

enrichment.title: A. The New Deal for Young People
enrichment.summary: The welfare state fails to provide opportunities for millions facing unemployment or poverty.

header: **A. The New Deal for Young People**
text: Secondly, we must ensure that work pays. Thirdly, everyone who seeks to advance through employment and education must be given the means to advance.

enrichment.title: A. The New Deal for Young People
enrichment.summary: The text emphasizes making work rewarding and providing opportunities for advancement through employment and education.

header: **A. The New Deal for Young People**
text: So we will create a new ladder of opportunity that will allow the many, by their own efforts, to benefit from opportunities once open only to a few.

enrichment.title: A. The New Deal for Young People
enrichment.summary: A new ladder of opportunity will enable broader access to benefits previously limited to a few.

header: **A. The New Deal for Young People**
text: Starting from next year, every young person aged 18 to 25 who is unemployed for more than six months will be offered a first step on the employment ladder.

enrichment.title: A. The New Deal for Young People
enrichment.summary: Unemployed youth aged 18-25 will receive employment opportunities after six months of unemployment starting next year.

entities.text: The New Deal for Young People

header: **A. The New Deal for Young People**
text: Tomorrow, my right hon. Friend the Secretary of State for Education and Employment will detail the four options, all involving training leading to qualifications--a job with an employer; work with a voluntary organisation;

enrichment.title: A. The New Deal for Young People
enrichment.summary: The Secretary of State for Education and Employment will outline four training options leading to qualifications, including jobs with employers and work with voluntary organizations.

entities.text: Secretary of State for Education and Employment

header: **A. The New Deal for Young People**
text: This new deal for the young is comprehensive, rich in opportunity, linked to the development of skills and has already attracted the support of some of Britain's leading companies.

enrichment.title: A. The New Deal for Young People
enrichment.summary: The New Deal for Young People offers comprehensive opportunities, skill development, and has gained support from major British companies.

header: **A. The New Deal for Young People**
text: I urge every business to play its part in this national crusade to equip this country for the future by taking on young unemployed men and women.

enrichment.title: A. The New Deal for Young People
enrichment.summary: Businesses are encouraged to support young unemployed individuals as part of a national effort to prepare for the future.

header: **A. The New Deal for Young People**
text: I appeal to every voluntary organisation to make a further contribution to the work that they do in the community by taking on a young person.

enrichment.title: A. The New Deal for Young People
enrichment.summary: Voluntary organizations are urged to support community work by engaging young individuals.

entities.text: The New Deal for Young People

header: **A. The New Deal for Young People**
text: I will make it possible for every Member of the House to act as an ambassador for this venture, encouraging young people in their constituencies, consulting local businesses and bringing them together to play their part in this new deal for young people.

enrichment.title: A. The New Deal for Young People
enrichment.summary: Encourages collaboration among lawmakers, businesses, and communities to support young people through the new deal initiative.

header: **A. The New Deal for Young People**
text: The New Deal for Young People will commence in 12 "pathfinder areas" in January 1998. The pathfinder areas, announced on 28 July 1997, are Tayside, Swansea and West Wales, Sheffield and Rotherham, Eastbourne, Lambeth, Harlow and Stevenage, Cumbria, Wirral, South Derbyshire, Black Country (North and South), Newcastle (including Gateshead and South Tyne), and Cornwall.<sup>4</sup>

enrichment.title: A. The New Deal for Young People
enrichment.summary: The New Deal for Young People begins in 12 pathfinder areas in January 1998, announced on 28 July 1997.

entities.text: The New Deal for Young People

header: **A. The New Deal for Young People**
text: *Design of the New Deal for 18-24 year olds*. 5 The programme will cover all young people aged 18-24 who have been claiming Jobseeker's Allowance (JSA) for six months or more.

enrichment.title: A. The New Deal for Young People
enrichment.summary: The New Deal targets 18-24-year-olds claiming Jobseeker's Allowance for six months or more.

header: **A. The New Deal for Young People**
text: The stock of 18-24 year olds who will have already been unemployed for 6 months when the New Deal is introduced will enter the Gateway (the first stage of the New Deal programme) when they reach their Restart interview.

enrichment.title: A. The New Deal for Young People
enrichment.summary: Unemployed 18-24 year olds for 6 months will enter the Gateway stage of the New Deal at their Restart interview.

header: **A. The New Deal for Young People**
text: These take place every 6 months. Young people who reach 6 months of unemployment after the introduction of the New Deal will enter the programme immediately.

enrichment.title: A. The New Deal for Young People
enrichment.summary: Young people unemployed for 6 months will immediately join the New Deal program, which operates on a 6-month cycle.

header: **A. The New Deal for Young People**
text: There is provision for entering the New Deal early at the discretion of the Employment Service but certain groups will be able to automatically enter early if they wish.

enrichment.title: A. The New Deal for Young People
enrichment.summary: Certain groups can enter the New Deal early, either automatically or at the Employment Service's discretion.

header: **A. The New Deal for Young People**
text: These groups include lone parents, people whose first language is not English or Welsh, ex-offenders, those who have become unemployed as a result of large scale redundancies and people leaving care.

enrichment.title: A. The New Deal for Young People
enrichment.summary: The text identifies target groups facing barriers to employment, including lone parents, non-native speakers, ex-offenders, redundancy-affected individuals, and care leavers.

header: **A. The New Deal for Young People**
text:
The formal announcement, however, came in Gordon Brown's first Budget on 2 July 1997:3

In the new economy, in which capital, inventions and even raw materials are mobile, Britain has only one truly national resource: the talent and potential of its people.

enrichment.title: A. The New Deal for Young People
enrichment.summary: Gordon Brown announced the New Deal for Young People in his first Budget, emphasizing Britain's reliance on its people's talent and potential in a mobile economy.

header: **A. The New Deal for Young People**
text:
So today this Budget is taking the first steps to create the new welfare state for the 2lst century.

The welfare state was and remains a great British achievement.

enrichment.title: A. The New Deal for Young People
enrichment.summary: The budget introduces steps to modernize the welfare state for the 21st century, emphasizing its historical significance as a British achievement.

header: **A. The New Deal for Young People**
text:
So it is time for the welfare state to put opportunity back into people's hands.

First, everyone in need of work should have the opportunity to work.

enrichment.title: A. The New Deal for Young People
enrichment.summary: Advocates for welfare reforms to provide work opportunities for everyone in need.

header: **A. The New Deal for Young People**

work on the environmental task force; and, for those without basic qualifications, the chance of full-time education or training.

With those new opportunities for young people come new responsibilities. There will be no fifth option--to stay at home on full benefit. So when they

sign on for benefit, they will be signing up for work. Benefits will be cut if young people refuse to take up the opportunities.

header: **B. New Deal for the Long-term Unemployed**
text:
The formal announcement came in the Budget statement on 2 July 1997.20 The programme will start in June 1998

There are two elements to the New Deal for the Long-term Unemployed:

• payments of £75 per week for 26 weeks to employers who recruit people aged 25 and over who have been unemployed for two years or more; and

<sup>17</sup> see Appendix I

<sup>18 &</sup>quot;Welfare to work may focus on older jobless", *Financial Times*, 26 September 1997.

<sup>19</sup> HC 85, July 1997, p 33

<sup>20</sup> HC Deb 2 July 1997, c 309

• opportunities for those unemployed for two years or more to study for up to twelve months in full time employment-related courses designed to reach an accredited qualification. This will be achieved by relaxing the 16 hour rule which prevents unemployed people from receiving benefit while studying full-time.

A total of £350 million from the windfall tax has been allocated to the programme over the period 1997-2002:21

enrichment.title: New Deal for the Long-term Unemployed

header: **B. The Intermediate Labour Market and Voluntary Sector Options**
text:
- Its primary aim is to offer the long-term unemployed and those who are furthest from the labour market a bridge back to the world of work.
- It combines relevant high quality vocational training with a substantial period of work experience and personal development including job search activity.
- It creates a realistic work environment for the long-term unemployed with all of the key characteristics of employment
  - -A rate for the job wage -A contract with rights and obligations -Quality management and supervision -The work carried out is to a high quality and of real value -Voluntary participation -A work reference for future employers
- It is well managed and has a lifespan beyond the duration of any particular funding regime.
- It adds to the supply of jobs particularly where there are weak local economies.

enrichment.title: The Intermediate Labour Market and Voluntary Sector Options
enrichment.summary: A program providing long-term unemployed individuals vocational training, work experience, and personal development in a realistic employment setting to enhance employability and job creation in weak local economies.

enrichment.title: D. Lone Parents - Progress Report
enrichment.summary: Lone parents face challenges with benefit tapers affecting incentives for full-time work over part-time or unemployment.
